problem: Find the product and simplify the expression: $(2x^3 - x + 4)(3x^2 - 2x - 5)$.
solution:
Using the distributive property (also known as the FOIL method for binomials), we calculate each term: 
\begin{align*}
&(2x^3 - x + 4)(3x^2 - 2x - 5) \\
&= 2x^3(3x^2 - 2x - 5) - x(3x^2 - 2x - 5) + 4(3x^2 - 2x - 5) \\
&= 6x^5 - 4x^4 - 10x^3 - 3x^3 + 2x^2 + 5x + 12x^2 - 8x - 20 \\
&= 6x^5 - 4x^4 - 13x^3 + 14x^2 - 3x - 20 \\
&= \boxed{6x^5 - 4x^4 - 13x^3 + 14x^2 - 3x - 20}.
\end{align*}
